name: 陳偉堯
objective: This is the first programming language course for freshmen of the Swaziland mining program. The programming language of choice is Fortran. The topics covered in this course includes Linux operations and commands, IDE usage, Fortran architecture, branching structures, loops manipulation, input/output concepts, arrays manipulation, characters manipulation, and procedure calls.
schedule:
Week 1: using Linux (ubuntu)
Week 2: installing code::blocks
Week 3: Chapman 1 and Linux desktop
Week 4: using IDE
Week 5: Virtual machines
Week 6: Chap. 2 of Chapman 
Week 7: Chap. 3 of Chapman, part 1
Week 8: Chap. 3 of Chapman, part 2
Week 9: Midterm 
Week 10: Discuss the midterm exam (First half of Chap. 4 Loops)
Week 11: Second half of Chap. 4 Loops
Week 12: First half of Chap. 5
Week 13: Second half of Chap. 5
Week 14: Chap. 6 (min. and sorting)
Week 15: Array and procedures
Week 16: Procedures
Week 17: linear regression
Week 18: Final
materials:
Chapman, S. J. (2004). Fortran 90/95 for Scientists and Engineers, Second edition, McGraw Hill, 814 pages, ISBN: 007-282575-8
Brookshear, J. G. (201?). Computer Science, An Overview, 11th Edition, Pearson International Edition
